Pre-Game Insights: West Indies and South Africa face off in virtual quarter-final at T20 World Cup
Winner goes through to the final four, loser goes out
Additional tickets have been made available for the T20 World Cup game between West Indies and South Africa
South Africa has a perfect record of six wins in six games, while West Indies were unbeaten through the group stage
West Indies lost to England in the Super Eight after an unbeaten run in the group stage
South Africa's recent close wins have been attributed to good fortune rather than consistent performance
Alzarri Joseph has taken 11 tournament wickets with an average of 13.81 and a strike rate of 11 balls per wicket
Marco Jansen has an economy rate of 5.90 and has been crucial in match-winning situations
Shai Hope's unbeaten 39-ball 82 against USA may mean West Indies do not immediately call upon Kyle Mayers
South Africa's last match in Antigua saw them opt for two spinners and leave Ottneil Baartman out, which may be considered again
The pitch at North Sound seems good for run-scoring, but there may be a slight difference due to it being a night fixture
There have only been three totals of over 200 at the T20 World Cup so far, with West Indies scoring the highest total of 218
Nicholas Pooran is the tournament's top run-scorer with 227 runs, followed closely by Quinton de Kock in third place
Miscellaneous Highlights: The co-hosts are on track to achieve their goal of re-establishing West Indies as a powerhouse by competing strongly and hopefully winning a third T20 World Cup
If West Indies score 160 and win by 52 runs, they could even go past England and top Group 2
